Description:
For our Product Development Center in Espoo, Finland (or remote location within Finland),
we are looking for an enthusiastic Software Engineer who will help us build a sustainable solution platform for our future growth. And that's where you come in!
About the Company
At Topcon Positioning Group, headquartered in Livermore, California, USA, we design, manufacture and distribute productivity tools for developing a brighter future. Whether cultivating the earth or building upon it, Topcon brings innovation in workflow automation and seamless connectivity of data to construction, geopositioning and agriculture industries focused on developing a sustainable tomorrow.

Description:
Why join us?
Are you passionate about sustainability, innovation, safety, and collaboration? Do you want to grow together with a company that is forward-looking and continuously improving how they work? Our employees have ideas on how to build a sustainable future and the drive and passion to realize them. They believe that building long-term relationships and integrity are keys to success. Description:
The ideal candidate for this opening is someone who is willing to work crossfunctionally on both data science features and data processing at an ambitious startup.

Personally, you are:
Self-motivated
Honest and passionate
Learn quickly and continously
Meeshkan employees are those who:
Communicate effectively with clients and teammates
Curious about technology and the impact it can make on the world
Tasks

Requirements

Benefits

This role works closely with Mike Meeshkan’s CEO, and with the engineering team.


1. 30 minute video call with our COO, Makenna
2. Take home exercise, if applicable
3. Video call with Mike, CEO of Meeshkan
4. Offer & "What will make you most successful in this position?"

On average the whole process takes 2-3 weeks end to end, but we're pretty flexible!

We understand the combination of backend and data science chops, is a hard one to find. Our preference is on candidates with strong backend experience, we have an incredible team of data science engineers that you can collaborate with and learn from!

Even if you don't believe you fit all of the requirements but you're interested in the product / position — please apply! We're looking forward to hearing from you.

Elisa Data & Analytics department is responsible for development of large-scale analytics to various Elisa's business needs. We value the data and we are focused on learning how to support our customers better and want to produce experiences in our customers' everyday life.
We're looking for a Data Engineer for the Elisa Data & Analytics team to work together with our skilled Architect, Data Engineers and Scientists.
Your main project would be designing and implementing data integrations between different systems and engineering many kinds of solutions for data handling and machine learning. These complex systems require skills from data integration and solid coding experience.
In this job, you can use your skills in a creative and versatile way right at the heart of our company. You will get a chance to make your own system choices and direct development work in the right direction in line with your own vision.

Description:
Data Engineer
Tehtävässä olet osana tiivistä kehitys- ja ylläpitotiimiä, jonka työnä on rakentaa ja ylläpitää dataputkia sekä kehittää tietovarastointia pankkien viranomaisraportointiin. Menestymisen kannalta olennaisia ominaisuuksia ovat SQL-osaaminen, kiinnostus laajojen kokonaisuuksien hallintaan ja ongelmanratkaisuun sekä sitoutuminen jatkuvaan prosessiin, jossa dataputkia kehitetään ja automatisoidaan. Myös Azure-pilviympäristön tunteminen asettaa sinut etulyöntiasemaan.
Työn ytimen muodostavat datavirran end-to-end hallinnointi lähdejärjestelmistä raportointiin sekä datan jalostaminen käyttökelpoiseen muotoon. Käsiteltävä data liittyy mm. pankkien rahoitusinstrumentteihin ja datan käyttökohteet liittyvät pääosin pankkien riskienhallintaan ja viranomaisraportointiin, joten kiinnostus finanssialaa kohtaan ja ymmärrys pankkiliiketoiminnasta katsotaan eduksi. Tarkka tehtäväsi muotoutuu oman osaamisesi perusteella - tietovarastoinnin syväosaajana pääset aiheen vaikeiden kehitystehtävien pariin ja Azure-osaajana pääset toteuttamaan tietovarastointia myös pilvessä.

Description:
SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT
FINLAND
DATA
Are you already an experienced data engineer or a talent wanting to pivot your role from software engineering to data engineering? We are building a Data and IoT Center of Excellence in Finland, so now is a perfect time to join the team to build something big. You will get to work side-by-side with top-of-the-world experts in data and IoT development.

At Nortal we help organizations harness the power of data and IoT with automated software solutions. Our software engineers are experts in building new hybrid applications in Cloud and Edge, and migrating legacy systems to this architecture. If you want to join an international and growing company, work in great and humorous teams without excess policies or hierarchies - then we have the perfect match for you!

Description:
Gofore on digitaalisen muutoksen asiantuntija. Meitä on Suomessa, Saksassa, Itävallassa, Espanjassa, Virossa ja Italiassa noin 1300 alan johtavaa asiantuntijaa. Hyvinvoivat työntekijät ja menestyvät asiakkaat ovat yrityksemme ydin. Monimuotoista osaajajoukkoamme yhdistää pioneerihenkisyys sekä halu työskennellä yrityksessä, jossa luodaan inhimillisempää, kestävämpää ja eettisempää digimaailmaa. Haluamme tarjota parhaat mahdollisuudet työntekijöillemme kehittyä ja kukoistaa – sekä työssä että sen ulkopuolella. Liikevaihtomme vuonna 2022 oli 149,9 miljoonaa euroa. Gofore Oyj:n osake on listattu Nasdaq Helsinki Oy:ssä.
Lisätietoja Goforesta työnantajana löydät halutessasi liity joukkoon- ja kulttuurisivuiltamme.
Goforen matka tulevaisuuden datataloksi on alkanut! Meitä kiinnostaa ympäröivä maailma ja siksipä toimimmekin laaja-alaisesti niin julkisella kuin yksityisellä sektorilla. Monipuolisissa projekteissa teemme läheistä yhteistyötä erityisesti datatieteilijöiden kanssa – tiimissämme pääsee altistumaan data-aiheiden lisäksi mm. tekoälyyn ja koneoppimiseen liittyviin projekteihin.

Description:
We are now looking for a Data & Cloud Engineer to join the concrete pioneers at Betolar!
Do you strive for elegant and technically sound implementations? You have a wide profile with an emphasis on Data and Cloud engineering. Security is not just an afterthought for you. We are looking for a senior hands-on person with a sense of ownership and a self-starter mindset.
The actual work spans from standardizing data, to building out data pipelines, and cloud infrastructure. The role is part of our Data team and collaborating closely with our CloudOps function and product teams.
In terms of data volume, we are not among the big players, nor do we have tight latency requirements yet. However, the data is rich, and the problems are massively convoluted and non-trivial. And do check out our website, we strive for real impact fast!

Etsimme joukkoomme Data Engineeria mielenkiintoisten asiakashankkeiden pariin. Asiantuntijuus, tiimihenki ja ystävällisyys kuvastavat meitä hiqlaisia, samaa odotamme myös uudelta tiimiläiseltämme.
Data Engineerina työskentelet osana asiakastoimituksiamme. Laajasta asiakasverkostostamme löytyy keskisuuria ja suuria suomalaisia yrityksiä monilta eri toimialoilta.
Olemme erikoistuneet korkealaatuisiin digitaalisiin palveluihin, konsultointiin ja projektitoimituksiin. Ohjelmistokehitys, design, automaatio, dataosaaminen, pilvipalvelut, laadunvarmistus ja jatkuvat palvelut kuuluvat kaikki erityisosaamiseemme.
Kehittäjiltämme odotamme asiantuntemusta ja aitoa intoa teknologiaa kohtaan. Asiakaslähtöisyys ja tiimityöskentelytaidot ovat meidän asiakkuuksissamme avainasemassa. Innostava työyhteisö ja asiantunteva tiimi sekä aktiivinen kompetenssinkehitys ja tiedonjako tukevat onnistumista.

Description:
Our team is comprised of four professionals. Each member has own specialized area, but we collaborate and support each other in technical challenges and in the development of best practices. We work in a hybrid model with broad remote work possibilities, but on-site meetings are required about twice per month. This is a permanent position. Start date is negotiable, but preferably in May 2023.

Expanding our standard data offering to the organization
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data provided to our users

Job_title: Grow as Data Engineer with us - Solita´s personalised onboarding program
Description:
Growing as a Data Engineer onboarding program helps you to boost your growth as a professional, improving your skills eg. in cloud platforms and their services, databases, data development tools and methodologies as well as more general level consulting skills. With a wider and deeper skillset you´ll have more opportunities to find meaningful and challenging projects to work in.
What Data Engineers do in Solita?
Data Engineers are all-around and end-to-end developers and consultants handling data in all its shapes and sizes in order to fulfil the end users' data needs. Data Engineers work together with the Solita team in various customer projects, where data platforms and various data utilisation solutions are built, data storages are modernised and data is processed.

Description:
Työpaikan kuvaus
Haluaisitko rakentaa aikaa kestäviä dataratkaisuja ja kehittää pilvipohjaisia palveluja yhdessä muiden huippuasiantuntijoidemme kanssa? Olisimmeko me match made in data cloud? Jos sinulla on pää pilvissä mutta jalat maassa, saatat olla datatekemisemme hopeareunus.
Rekrytoimme aina sopivien dataosaajien osuessa kohdalle ja keskustelemme mielellämme kanssasi siitä, olisitko juuri sinä sopiva lisä tiimiimme. Data Engineerinä osallistut pilvipohjaisten tietoalustojen, dataputkien ja rajapintapalveluiden suunnitteluun, kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon. Asiakasprojekteissamme teemme dataratkaisuja Snowflakeen, AWS:ään ja Azureen ja hyödynnämme lisäksi mm. GCP:tä ja SQL:ää. Asiakasprojektimme ovat monipuolisia, ja asiakastiimeissämme on asiakkuuden tai projektin koosta riippuen usein myös analytiikkakonsultteja, jotka visualisoivat dataa loppukäyttäjille, sekä web-kehittäjiä.

Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
SALES ENGINEER, FINLAND
We are looking for a Sales Engineer who is accustomed to solving customer’s most complex problems and closing large deals. In this role you will work directly with the sales team and channel partners to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate winning sales cycles, provide compelling value-based demonstrations, support enterprise Proof of Concepts, and ultimately close business.
As a Snowflake Sales Engineer you must share our passion about reinventing the Data Warehousing space, thrive in a dynamic environment and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and talking shop with technical audiences.

Description:
The Packaging Solutions division develops and sells premium fiber-based packaging products and services. Our high-end eco-friendly packaging products are used by leading brands across multiple market sectors, including store retail, e-commerce and industrials. The portfolio includes corrugated and other converting, design services, automation solutions, and scalable innovations such as formed fiber and biocomposites.

We are looking for a Data and Analytics Developer to join us in creating solutions which enable business using facts to follow up the business performance and predict future business conditions with the help of data. You will work in Packaging Solutions Data Services team and report to its Team Lead. Your location could be at any of Stora Enso´s sites in Finland, Sweden or Czech Republic.

Career for a better climate. Every day.

As a Data and Analytics Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining analytics and reporting solutions. Tasks can vary from simple Excel to PowerBI solutions to data engineering on our Data Cloud. You will work as a part of Data Services team where we deliver value to our business by utilizing Agile methods and tools.

Description:
Etsimme kokeneita Data Engineeraja työskentelemään sekä pohjoismaissa että kansainvälisesti vaikuttavissa asiakasprojekteissa. Meillä pääset suunnittelemaan ja toteuttamaan moderneja data-ratkaisuja pilvipalveluiden päälle. Suomessa tukenasi on 50 hengen data- , ohjelmistokehitys-, design- sekä strategiatyön osaajien työyhteisö.
Arki Data Engineerinä
Meillä työskentelet yhdessä Thoughtworksin tiimin kanssa asiakasprojekteissa. Pääset työskentelemään Thougthworksiläisten kanssa vaihtelevissa projekteissa, jotka kestävät pääasiassa muutamasta kuukaudesta puoleen vuoteen, mutta löytyy meiltä pidempiäkin projekteja. Asiakasprojekteissamme rakennetaan muun muassa tietovarastoja, kerätään datoja asiakkaan järjestelmistä ja jalostetaan niistä asiakkaan datastrategiaa palvelevia datatuotteita. Työskentelet yhdessä Data Scientistien kanssa ja pääset rakentamaan dataputkia osana koneoppimisen ja tekoäly-projektien toteuttamista (käsittää esimerkiksi koneoppimista, lineaarista ohjelmointia, generatiivista mallinnusta, syy-seurauspäättelyä/kausaalipäättelyä).

Overview

We are strengthening our Data Operations team in Finland and looking for a Consumer Data Specialist. Description:
Are you passionate about software development and embedded systems? Are you a quick learner well suited for an international work environment? Are you a junior looking for a place to develop your skills or an established professional looking for the next step in your career?
We are looking for driven, self-guided embedded software experts at different stages of their careers to join our team. We offer you the freedom to create a career that looks like yourself and responsibilities to match your ambitions. The sky is the limit (literally)!
Who we are
We are a technology and design house full of independent thinkers and keen learners with humane hearts and bold attitudes. What unites us is our passion to pave way for a more humane and bold tomorrow for both people and our planet – with a twinkle in our eye.

Description:
Onko data edellä -ajattelu sinulle arkipäivää? Haluaisitko olla mukana kehittämässä ja rakentamassa modernia data-alustaa, joka helpottaisi hoiva- ja sosiaalialan ammattilaisten arjen työtä? Oletko kerryttänyt osaamista projektityöskentelystä? Etsimme Attendon tietohallintoon vakituiseen työsuhteeseen dataosaajaa, jolla on kiinnostusta data-arkkitehtuuria kohtaan. Roolissasi tulet työskentelemään läheisessä yhteistyössä liiketoiminnan ja muun tietohallinnon kanssa osana tiimiämme.
Arkkitehtuuri- ja ratkaisupalvelut tiimissämme on tällä hetkellä kuusi kokenutta asiantuntijaa, jotka vastaavat meillä mm. datasta, integraatioista, teknologiasta, Microsoftin M365-ympäristöstä sekä palvelinympäristöstämme. Tiimin tarkoituksena on helpottaa attendolaisten työtä ja parantaa Attendo-kotien asukkaiden kokemusta arjessa. Suunnittelemme ja kehitämme ympäristöämme jatkuvasti olemalla tiiviisti mukana liiketoimintaprojekteissa yhdessä muiden tietohallinnon ja palvelutoiminnon henkilöiden kanssa. Tällä hetkellä suurimpana työn alla olevana hankkeenamme on datan hyödyntäminen. Data edellä -ajattelu tulee tulevaisuudessa vain kasvamaan Attendolla, joten tähän liittyviä projekteja on tiedossa myös tulevaisuudessa.

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Are you a skilled Data Engineer up for owning the data pipeline of an upcoming game, in line to be our second hit? Ready to join one of Europe's fastest growing game companies?

If yes, Metacore could be the right place for you
We are a Helsinki-based game company best known for our hit game Merge Mansion and our people-first company culture. Built on trust, our culture allows us to work autonomously, efficiently, and ambitiously. We have mutually agreed on five cultural norms to describe how we build trust and work as Metacore – you can find them here.

Our company’s mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades. Although we already entertain 40,000,000+ players worldwide and have grown into a team of 120+ game industry professionals in less than two years, we’re only getting started. That’s where we hope you come in: to take ownership of the data pipeline of one of our upcoming games, and ensure its reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your expertise in data engineering, combined with your enthusiasm for data analysis, will enable you to generate informative visualizations and pursue engaging data science initiatives that enhance the team's performance.
Pros: ['"Fostering a company culture in a way that has been well thought out from the outset, revisited regularly and is exemplified by the founders A clear commitment to everybody’s wellbeing You\'re given true trust, where decisions are made by those who know best Every effort is made to promote togetherness as we grow Transparency as to where the company is going Fantastic colleagues that are all pushing in the same directionSo yeah, I’m a fan of this company and I could really recommend it to anyone looking for an interesting game career opportunity in Helsinki." In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data.

Description:
Our flexible, diverse, and casual work environment stimulates change and creates a motivating environment with highly efficient people. As part of our team, you will be an integral part of creating and supporting our products. ADVA’s products are the building blocks for tomorrow’s networks, enabling the transport of increasing amounts of data across the globe. From access to the metro core, to the long haul, we create intelligent, software-automated solutions that will provide future generations with networks that can scale to meet increasing bandwidth demands. Come be a part of the world’s most cutting-edge innovative solutions and products, from design to implementation.
With a diverse team spread across the globe, we have developed a culture that embraces creativity and seeks innovation in every aspect of what we do. At ADVA, we believe in our TEAM members and work hard to ensure that every voice is always heard.
ADVA is dedicated to the health and well-being of our employees, therefore, a series of comprehensive, quality wellness programs are available to all employees. In addition to receiving an equitable salary and having an equal opportunity for professional development and advancement, as an ADVA employee, you may be eligible to enjoy other health benefits and perks, which will enhance your job satisfaction. We have designed our work and life programs around our employees because we know that they spend the majority of their life at work.

Description:
Löytyykö sinusta draivia monipuolisiin asiakasprojekteihin, joissa sinulle mahdollistetaan ammatillinen kasvu nyt ja tulevaisuudessa?
Oletko tietomallinnuksen ja/tai ETL- kehittämisen osaaja ja etsit itsellesi kasvumahdollisuuksia? Data- ja analytiikkaprojektiemme kasvun myötä etsimme Data Engineeria kehittämään asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa.
Mistä on kyse?
Data & Analytics -liiketoiminnallamme on pitkä kokemus analyyttisista sovelluksista, joissa suurten tietomassojen käsittely ja hallinta ovat arkipäivää. Suunnittelemme ja toteutamme asiakkaillemme tiedonhallinnan ja analytiikan ratkaisuja, jotka palvelevat ja mahdollistavat monipuolisen tiedon hyödyntämisen suoraan liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Valitsemme käyttämämme teknologiat aina asiakastarpeen mukaisesti, mutta hyödynnämme ratkaisuissamme erityisesti Azurea.

Description:
At Silo AI engineers and researchers collaborate closely to tackle challenging real-world problems. The core competence of Silo AI relies on deep academic, and industry expertise in various fields of AI, covering machine learning, natural-language processing, computer vision among others. AI Engineers are expected to build innovative AI solutions powered by, and powering, Large Language Models (LLMs) that together with AI Scientists and software developers can be deployed in our products serving our clients.
What will you be doing
As an AI Engineer in Large Language Models, you'll work in a top tier team of AI experts, creating next-generation methods for creating safe, reliable and robust AI models. You'll closely collaborate in a team with scientists and product developers to implement our vision of human-centric AI and specifically, LLMs. You may choose to work from our offices in Helsinki or Stockholm, whichever suits you best.

Taking ownership of data-driven feature exploration, experimentation, and implementation
Working closely with our product teams and health advisors to convert business goals into data-driven products and features







(30 minutes)

Description:
Tule meille Azure Data Engineeriksi tehostamaan asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa. Projektimme vaihtelevat laajasti ja asiakkaita onkin eri kokoisissa organisaatoissa monella eri toimialalla. Yhteistä kaikille on kuitenkin se, että he tarvitsevat meidän apuamme ja sinun tiedoillasi ja taidoillasi on suuri merkitys projektien onnistumisessa ja asiakkaiden haasteiden ratkaisemisessa. Tule siis mukaan tekemään työtä, jolla on merkitystä.
Data Engineerinä osaat kääntää asiakkaidemme liiketoimintatarpeet teknisiksi ratkaisuiksi, joita pääset myös itse toteuttamaan. Suunnittelet ja rakennat asiakkaillemme Azure-pohjaisia integraatio- ja tietovarastoratkaisuja, joissa hyödynnät osaamistasi esimerkiksi Data Vault -mallinnusmenetelmästä. Oman osaamisesi mukaan voit olla mukana tekemässä hands-on konfiguraatioita, asennuksia ja skriptauksia sekä suunnittelemassa arkkitehtuureja. Eduksi katsomme myös osaamisen tai ymmärryksen tietovarastojen optimoimisesta tai Snowflake-osaamisesta.

Description:
Fidelix is a Finnish-based technology company that makes smarter buildings for a healthier future. We manufacture, deploy, and maintain automation systems and IoT solutions for smart buildings, with customers in the Nordics, the Benelux, and 30 countries worldwide. Our mission is to make buildings smarter to become carbon neutral, energy-efficient, and CO2-emission aware. Our goal is to become the #1 choice automation solution for building owners across the Nordics, as well as the most wanted employer in the entire industry by 2025. Fidelix Group has today turnover of 60M€ and about 400 employees.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Group Component & Design Engineer to join our Supply Chain and Business Applications team at Fidelix Group. The team is small but skillful having a Sourcing Manager and a Business Applications Manager. You also work closely with product development, product managers and sales teams. As a group function, we work with all Fidelix Group companies: Fidelix Oy, EcoGuard AB, Lansen AB and Larmia AB. The component engineer will report to Chief Supply Chain Officer.
The workplace is in recently renovated Fidelix Group headquarters in Vantaa, next to the Vantaankoski railway station. The role is new and you will have the opportunity to develop the role further in the future.

Description:
Tuotamme peleillä iloa ja suojelemme sitä. Haluamme, että suomalaisten pelaaminen pysyy ilon puolella. Tässä työssä vastuullisuus ohjaa kaikkea toimintaamme. Senior Data Engineer
Veikkauksen Data Platforms and Applications -yksikkö etsii nyt riveihinsä ennakkoluulotonta tekijää matkallemme kohti datakeskeistä tekemisen kulttuuria.

Description:
HypeHype Inc. (previously Frogmind) is an award-winning independent mobile games studio from Helsinki founded in 2012. We are best known for our games BADLAND series, Badland Brawl and Rumble Stars series which have garnered over 180 million players and won multiple industry awards.
Our ambitious new goal is to enable anyone to become a game maker in the same way YouTube & Tiktok did with video creators. We are building a new social user-generated content platform for creating, remixing and playing online games with a mobile phone, tablet or desktop. HypeHype, currently in early access, offers all the tools for making modern games and takes game creation from months of complex PC development to just hours of visual editing on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer.

Etsimme mukavaan ja kasvavaan joukkoomme kokenutta Data Engineeriä auttamaan asiakkaitamme menestymään modernien Data Platform -ratkaisujemme avulla. Roolissasi kokeneena tekijänä pääset paitsi luomaan merkityksellisiä dataratkaisuja asiakkaillemme myös jakamaan osaamistasi, kehittämään toimintamalleja sekä vaikuttamaan miten rakennamme ratkaisujamme tulevaisuudessa.

Fellowmindin tiedon hallinnan ratkaisut perustuvat erityisesti Azuren dataratkaisuihin (Data Factory, Synapse Analytics), joten arvostamme sinulta näiden tuntemusta. Odotamme sinulta kokemusta ja näkemystä isojen datakokonaisuuksien käsittelystä ja kehittämisestä sekä Data Engineering kokemusta siitä miten dataa hyödynnetäään osana operatiivista järjestelmää. Toivomme myös, että integraatiot, SQL ja DW -ratkaisut ovat sinulle tuttuja.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:

Create network monitoring infrastructure and work with internal and external teams to integrate the network monitoring data with supporting operational processes

Description:
Haemme Data Platform Engineer -osaajia Accenture Data & AI -yksikköön, jossa sinulla on mahdollisuus työskennellä samanhenkisten ja inspiroivien kollegoiden kanssa käyttäen uusimpia teknologioita.
Meille Data Platform Engineer tarkoittaa devops-kehittäjän ja sovelluskehittäjän yhdistelmää, jolla on vahva datapainotus. Tehtävänäsi on auttaa asiakkaitamme kehittämään korkealaatuisia pilvipohjaisia data-alustoja ja niihin liittyviä DevOps ja IaC -kyvykkyyksiä.
Data Platform Engineer roolissa osana tiimiä suunnittelet, toteutat/konfiguroit, testaat ja ylläpidät data-alustojen teknologiapinoa, kehitys- ja tuotantoympäristöjä sekä CI/CD ja IaC -automaatioita. Lisäsi tuet muuta tiimiä DevOps-ratkaisuiden käyttämisessä. Työnäsi on mahdollistaa ja nopeuttaa dataintensiivisten sovellusten kehittämistä. Tarvittaessa sinulla on myös itselläsi kyky toteuttaa dataintensiivisiä sovelluksia data-alustaan hyödyntäen. Työssäsi hyödynnät tarjolla olevia pilvipalveluita (Azure, AWS, GCP).

Description:
Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.
As a Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients’ data!
We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It’s all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.
In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. Description:
Summary
Posted: Dec 16, 2022
Role Number:200450019
Do something different! Apple is looking for a world class engineer that can help identify and incubate new display technologies. You will work with both suppliers and internal teams at Apple to shape the display related technologies that go into Apple products. A successful candidate will not only need to identify new tech, but also educate a broad audience of people at Apple about their benefits and tradeoffs. This position is focusing on the identification, prototyping, and communication of display technologies for future Apple products. The team features a diverse engineering roster including optical engineers, human perception experts, product design engineers, and experimental physicists. We work at a fast pace and require everyone to be highly self- motivated. A successful candidate needs to be a flexible thinker and be able to problem solve outside of their respective technical area.

Description:
R&D Engineer
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a R&D Engineer at ABB Oy, Large Motors and Generators division in Helsinki. You will be member of our mechanical performance team in Research and Development. In this role, you will contribute to product development projects, maintenance tasks, resolution of technical support cases by conducting simulations and measurements. You will have an opportunity to learn from experienced colleagues, grow your engineering skills in the field of mechanical simulation and measurement and take next steps in your career. You will work in an international organization in co-operation with sales, design, local and global manufacturing, and other ABB business lines. This position is located in Large Motors & Generators premises in Helsinki, Finland. Our R&D Engineers and scientists develop breakthrough technologies that change the way the world works, and industries do business. We constantly push the limits of convention, while retaining our focus on delivering solid returns for our customers and shareholders. Description:
At the moment we are looking for Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Helsinki to work on developing next-generation computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) technologies. The responsibility involves working with various problems related to CV and NLP but is not limited to object recognition, video understanding, OCR, natural language analysis, and visual-language multimodal. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users.
As a member of this team, you will use your deep understanding of your engineering skills to tackle meaningful technical problems and collaborate with the world’s most innovative product development teams. Together with other researchers, you will perform designing, implementing, and optimizing CV/NLP/ML algorithms to tackle new challenges and hardware capabilities in large model training. You will have the opportunity to transfer your knowledge into solutions for some of the most challenging technical problems in the next generation products.

Job_title: Senior Backend Engineer (Campaign Overview and Reporting)
Description:
We're looking for an experienced backend-oriented developer to join our reporting focused team called Bobby Tables. Our number-crunching service aggregates data from multiple sources within and outside Smartly.io making it one of the most data-heavy parts of the application. Customers can analyze performance of their ad campaigns by using the flexible report builder and data visualizer tool our team has developed.
Besides providing a customer-facing interface to the online analytical processing (OLAP) system that allows it to run complex analysis, the service offers programmatic access to the Reporting engine powering such features as automated actions and automated budget optimizations. The challenges lie in different areas: the scale of the database (several terabytes of data), complexity of database queries powered by flexible query language exposed as REST API, having numerous stakeholders both on client and data ingestion sides. The data structures have been evolving from being focused on one ad serving channel to being abstract cross-channel.

Description:

Our mission is to revolutionise the way doctors and patients approach the diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular disease, and we need your help.
We're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and work on developing machine learning models that improve the accuracy and speed of cardiovascular disease diagnosis, ultimately leading to better patient outcomes and lives saved.

Description:
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join the Creative Intelligence Team at Smartly! Our team works on helping marketers make the most of their ad creatives (images, video, text). We build solutions that help marketers with creative learning, AI-driven creative production assistance, and creative optimization. You will have the opportunity to take ownership of and lead high impact projects.
We are technology agnostic and always aim to choose the best tools for the job. We favor Python, Postgres, and AWS-based solutions. We use a combination of serverless and Kubernetes-based (EKS) infrastructure.
Our team members are based out of the United States, with most people working out of the San Francisco Bay Area. We are hiring for this position in Berlin or Helsinki to be closer to the rest of Smartly.io's product development org. The Media Intelligence team, our sibling team under the Advertising Intelligence banner, is also based out of Helsinki/Berlin. Our team works with teams in these locations often, and we've been able to effectively collaborate, despite the time zone difference.

Description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Description:
Aalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 12 000 students, 400 professors and close to 4 000 other faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo and at the Metsähovi Radio Observatory in Kirkkonummi, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community’s diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community.
We are looking for two Research Engineers for Aalto University Metsähovi Radio Observatory.
Metsähovi Radio Observatory
is the only astronomical radio observatory in Finland and one of the very few in Europe. We operate several radio telescopes and other radio-frequency equipment to carry out astronomical observations literally 24/7, every day of the year. Our specialities include long-term radio monitoring of active galactic nuclei and the Sun at millimetre-wavelengths, and we frequently participate in Very Long Baseline Interferometric (VLBI) observations in global radio telescope networks. The main frequencies range from 22 to 86 GHz (with observing capabilities up to 150 GHz) for the main 14-m radio telescope, with other antennas operating between 50 MHz and 12 GHz. The radio observatory is located in Kirkkonummi, some 35 kilometres from the university main campus, inside a radio-quiet zone.

Description:
At Fortum O&M Services, we operate power plants using industry-leading expertise and technology. Our task is to ensure the availability, efficiency and reliability of the assets, with the highest standards in safety and sustainability. This expertise stems from long experience in serving both our own fleet as well as a wide range of international O&M customers.
About the role
We are looking for Sales Engineer to join our Sales Support team in Operation and Maintenance (O&M) Services which is part of Fortum Recycling & Waste. In this role you will be supporting the growth of our business and reporting to Senior Manager, Sales Support.
As a Sales Engineer you will have responsibility on sales and tendering activities of our established software solutions offering for existing power plant customer base covering both our own fleet as well as customers’ O&M sites mainly in the Nordics, UK, Germany, and the Baltics. Our advanced digital tools include e.g. (CMMS) for asset and maintenance management, for process information and optimisation, and (static/dynamic) for modelling, analysing and training on power plant processes.

Description:
At Silo AI engineers and researchers collaborate closely to tackle challenging real-world problems. We're seeking AI engineers with the ability to build robust and scalable production systems, quickly obtain a deep technical understanding of new domains, and solve the most important problems in large teams. What will you be doing

You may choose to work from our offices in Helsinki , Stockholm or any other office, whichever suits you best.

Description:
Design Engineer, Mechanical
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

You will be creating and executing project-specific mechanical designs as a part of the highly skilled engineering team in Large Motors and Generators in Helsinki. This includes drawings, calculations, bill of materials, engineering instructions and processes. In this role you will have the opportunity for personal development in the form of training as well as the opportunity for professional development. Your skills and technical expertise will contribute to a variety of design projects. Benefits we offer at the moment include e.g. an annual performance bonus, a flexible working model, subsidized lunch, employee share ownership program, benefits for families with children, sports, massage and cultural benefits and many hobby clubs.

Description:
Haemme Data Platform Engineer -osaajia Accenture Data & AI -yksikköön, jossa sinulla on mahdollisuus työskennellä samanhenkisten ja inspiroivien kollegoiden kanssa käyttäen uusimpia teknologioita.
Meille Data Platform Engineer tarkoittaa devops-kehittäjän ja sovelluskehittäjän yhdistelmää, jolla on vahva datapainotus. Tehtävänäsi on auttaa asiakkaitamme kehittämään korkealaatuisia pilvipohjaisia data-alustoja ja niihin liittyviä DevOps ja IaC -kyvykkyyksiä.
Data Platform Engineer roolissa osana tiimiä suunnittelet, toteutat/konfiguroit, testaat ja ylläpidät data-alustojen teknologiapinoa, kehitys- ja tuotantoympäristöjä sekä CI/CD ja IaC -automaatioita. Lisäsi tuet muuta tiimiä DevOps-ratkaisuiden käyttämisessä. Työnäsi on mahdollistaa ja nopeuttaa dataintensiivisten sovellusten kehittämistä. Tarvittaessa sinulla on myös itselläsi kyky toteuttaa dataintensiivisiä sovelluksia data-alustaan hyödyntäen. Työssäsi hyödynnät tarjolla olevia pilvipalveluita (Azure, AWS, GCP).

Description:
At Solita Data Science & Analytics community, we support our clients during their whole AI & Analytics journey – from the very beginning of ideation all the way to scaling the utilization of AI & Analytics across the organisation. We also take a holistic view to business problems, and see that in addition to technical skills, for instance consulting skills and design thinking methods are crucial to identify the problems worth solving – and how best to solve them. In cross-functional teams we develop solutions that harness the potential of AI & analytics technologies, generate value for the end users, and deliver sustainable business impact for the clients.
What does a Machine Learning Architect do?
As a Machine Learning (ML) Architect you will map the current state of AI solutions and related data & analytics capabilities of our customers. You will help them to outline future goals, to identify opportunities ahead, and to create a concrete roadmap to achieve them. Most importantly, you design and build production-grade AI solutions and platforms, where machine learning models are run, e.g. utilizing the capacity and services offered by cloud vendors, and create the best possible conditions for utilizing machine learning models and algorithms in the daily lives of our customers. In projects, you are one of the leading experts and your closest colleagues include Data Scientists, ML Engineers, and AI Service Designers or Strategists. As a senior expert, you also participate in the asset, ways of working, and offering development of Solita.

Businesses of every size, including the world’s biggest brands and events, trust Ekahau to get the best performance from their wireless networks.

Description:
Position: Machine Learning Engineer
Location: Luxembourg, Finland
Hiring Model: Hybrid/ On-site
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help explore novel deep learning capabilities that can be applied to remote sensing imagery. You will report to the Machine Learning Team Lead in the Analytics Department. We are looking for candidates in Finland or those who want to relocate to Finland.



:


Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE
We are making the impossible possible together.
Contact
Olha Pryshlyak
Recruiting@iceye.fi

Description:
Kiinnostaako sinua työskentely Suomen kolmanneksi suurimmassa rahoituslaitoksessa? Haluatko olla vaikuttamassa suomalaista yhteiskuntaa vastuullisesti rakentavan luottolaitoksen kehitykseen, keskeisessä roolissa laadukkaan ja tavoitteellisen tietovarastoinnin kehittäjänä?
Haemme asiakkaallemme Kuntarahoitukselle Yrityssuunnittelu ja Tiedonhallinta -yksikköön kokenutta Tietovarastoarkkitehtiä.
Tehtävässä sinulla on kokonaisvastuu tietoalustamme ja keskitetyn tietovarastomme arkkitehtuurista, tietomalleista ja niiden kehittämisestä sekä käytännön toteutuksesta. Tietoalustalla ja tietovarastollamme on keskeinen rooli kokonaisarkkitehtuurissamme, tukien tehokasta liiketoimintaa ja luoden perustan laadukkaalle ja pitkälle automatisoidulle raportoinnille. Tulevina vuosina tulemme laajentamaan tietovarastoa ja sen käyttöä erityisesti taloudellisen tiedon ja raportoinnin alueella. Sinulla on näissä keskeinen rooli ymmärtämällä tietoalustaan ja -varastoon kohdistuvia odotuksia ja kehitystarpeita sekä niiden muuntamisessa laadukkaiksi, tavoitearkkitehtuurin mukaisiksi suunnitelmiksi ja ratkaisuiksi. Tuet ja ohjaat kehittäjiä kokemuksellasi ja menetelmäosaamisellasi ratkaisujen toteuttamisessa ja ylläpidossa.

Job_title: Data Engineer / Python, DataBricks and realtime streaming
Description:
Data Engineer / Python, DataBricks and realtime streaming
azneleh01_1675183672
If you're a Data Engineer located in Finland that is passionate about their work, the environment and the planet going carbon neutral by 2030, this is the perfect job for you!


This role is so important as IoT / Real time streaming analytics is going to be so crucial in collecting data from multiple sources e.g wind turbines, solar panels, thermal energy from the ocean, nuclear reactors. This is the key towards the company being carbon neutral.


They are 90% in an Azure environment right now and are looking to become totally Azure focused soon. They have an unreal Tech stack and are working very closely with Microsoft. To name some of their tech stack


Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse (For the Data Warehouse Solution), Azure IoT Hub / Event Hub to build real time streaming capabilities, Azure Databricks for Machine Learning. Spark is also on the horizon. Azure Purview for their MDM / Cataloguing tool

Benefits


Salary

4500-5300EUR + Bonus

Description:
At Silo AI engineers and researchers collaborate closely to tackle challenging real-world problems. The core competence of Silo AI relies on deep academic expertise in various fields of AI, covering machine learning, natural-language processing, computer vision among others. AI Scientists are expected to build innovative AI solutions that together with engineers and system developers can be deployed as real-time solutions to provide customer value.
What will you be doing
As an AI Scientist in Computer Vision, you'll work in a top tier team of AI experts, solving real-life cases using the latest Computer Vision (CV) & ML techniques. You'll closely collaborate with an engineering team to bring models into toolkits, and business developers top impress the client. You may choose to work from our offices in Helsinki, Turku, Stockholm or Oulu, whichever suits you best.

Description:
We are looking for you
We at Clevry are looking for a Mechanical Engineer for our client Metso: Outotec, Espoo. The position is full-time (37,5h per week) with a permanent contract, and you will be employed via Clevry. The start date for this position will be as soon as a suitable person is found.
In the role of a Mechanical Engineer, you will have the opportunity to participate in diverse, international, and varied Flotation product design projects. The team ensures that equipment designs throughout their product portfolio are safe, relevant, sustainable, reliable and cost-competitive. Your day-to-day tasks will include mechanical designing, technical drawing, and 3D designing using SolidWorks. You will collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and provide support around the Flotation product globally. Your team will consist of about 15 people, with varied levels of experience and you will receive comprehensive training for the role.

Description:
Position Description:

Test Engineer, Banking sector

We are now looking for a Test Engineer to work on our strategic client assignments in the banking sector.

You will play a key role in our deliveries as a trusted member of our high performing development teams. In your role you will work hands-on with highly skilled colleagues and challenging testing tasks specialized in performance testing and test automation.

Your Role:
Designing, developing and coordinating testing activities





Don`t worry if you do not meet all the criteria, because what we value the most is a positive, proactive and solution-oriented attitude towards work.


We know that one of the key components of our success is the talent, skills and knowledge of the people who join our team - professionals like you. This is what we offer:

Meaningful job and exciting tasks: You will work in challenging projects with products and services that add true value to our customers.

Experienced and enthusiastic colleagues: You will be part of a dynamic and innovative team where everyone's knowledge and competences are valued. We strive to create an environment where our professionals enjoy working together and feel empowered.

Excellent opportunities to learn and to develop yourself: Your career and professional development will be our top priorities. We offer many career paths, and various learning and development programs.

Benefits of a large and global IT company: We are one of the leading IT companies in the world. In Finland we work locally and customer-oriented. We combine strong local expertise, global resources and certified business models.


Great, because we would love to hear from you! For additional questions, you can contact: Joel Keränen, Director Consulting Services, +358 40 1722774, joel.keranen@cgi.com.

The application period will end and we recommend applying for the position as soon as possible as we will be reviewing applications already during the application period and proceeding with the most suitable candidate. Before an employment relationship can be established, the chosen applicant is required to have his/her credit report to be checked. A standard security clearance will also be conducted for the chosen applicant.

The position is located in the greater Helsinki area.

Job_title: FAST Rotation Program-Field Applications Engineer Track - FInland
Description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
This 11-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams.
Rotation 1 (6 month), Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.

Description:
You: Ambitious programmer equipped with deep technical knowledge craving to apply it in an environment of trust and independence where ownership of what you do is a given.

We: Supercell's Services Team
Our team develops shared systems, tools, platforms and services for Supercell games and player experience teams. These systems include live-ops tools to manage in-game campaigns and data processing pipelines that ingest billions of game events daily.

We aim to design long-term solutions that are flexible, scalable, secure, and yet only require minimal maintenance. An engineer able to build such systems should have extensive technical expertise, the ability to work independently, and the commitment to follow through on big ideas. Job_title: Structural Analyst Engineer (FEA) - Finland or Spain
Description:
Job title: Structural Analyst Engineer (FEA)
Location: Espoo, Finland OR Spain
Hiring Model: Hybrid
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
To support the company’s growth, we continue to scale our Structural Analysis/Mechanical team and looking for a Structural Analyst (FEA) Engineer to join our global Spacecraft Engineering Team.
About the role?
As a Structural Analyst Engineer, you will analyze the structure for strength and resiliency on the whole spacecraft, how it behaves as an entire unit, but also on smaller components of the satellite - verify and analyze the mechanical structures produced by the Mechanical Team to ensure it will survive launch and the environment.

Responsibilities




We are making the impossible possible together. Could this be the role for you? You can apply now to start your journey with ICEYE.
Contact
Riya Vidhani (Talent Acquisition Partner)
www.iceye.com

Description:
Nipromec Oy Ltd is an international consulting and engineering company founded in 2003. We offer design and consulting services for multiple industries with emphasis on energy and construction. Nipromec offices in Finland are located in Rauma, Turku, Tampere and Helsinki. Group has offices also in Erlangen, Germany, Bristol and London in United Kingdom.
We are now looking for a LEAD PIPING ENGINEER to work for customer projects in Tampere region for permanent employment.
You will work as a main designer in versatile Finnish and international industry projects and you will be in charge of a designing group.

As Lead Piping Engineer, you are responsible for coordinating the project’s piping engineering discipline, leading core & subcontracted engineering, and working closely with the procurement and other various project functions. Your typical day includes follow-up with team members and progress reporting. You will be a key participant in customer meetings and driving “best-in-class” customer solutions from the sales phase, continuing through start-up & “as built” documentation.

Job_title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
Description:
We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.
The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.
This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.

Job_title: Software Engineer (experience in computer security) Abu Dhabi
Description:
While a lot is being done to discover security vulnerabilities in software via several bug bounty programs, the state of software security is not getting improve at the same pace. One possible reason could be that the momentum is not that high in automated tools and techniques for various security related tasks. It is mostly done manually by experts. In this role, you will be tasked with developing automated techniques that address security challenges spanning from automated detection of vulnerabilities to automated bug patching, given a binary executable.
Another dimension to consider is to leverage recent advancements in hardware assisted security features (e.g. Intel CET, ARM memory tagging) to make software analyses scale well with reasonable overhead. As a researcher, you will establish your project in the related theme and work with existing researchers and engineers with a possible collaboration with top universities across the globe. We do expect (and encourage) high quality publications as milestones of your project/work in top security venues, Usenix Sec, NDSS, IEEE S&P, CCS, ACSAC,RAID etc.

Description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Description:
Position: Machine Learning Engineer
Location: Luxembourg, Finland
Hiring Model: Hybrid/ On-site
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help explore novel deep learning capabilities that can be applied to remote sensing imagery. You will report to the Machine Learning Team Lead in the Analytics Department. We are looking for candidates in Finland or those who want to relocate to Finland.



:


Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE
We are making the impossible possible together.

Job_title: FAST Rotation Program-Field Applications Engineer Track - FInland
Description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
This 11-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams.
Rotation 1 (6 month), Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.

Description:
Haemme Data Platform Engineer -osaajia Accenture Data & AI -yksikköön, jossa sinulla on mahdollisuus työskennellä samanhenkisten ja inspiroivien kollegoiden kanssa käyttäen uusimpia teknologioita.

Tarvittaessa sinulla on myös itselläsi kyky toteuttaa dataintensiivisiä sovelluksia data-alustaan hyödyntäen. Työssäsi hyödynnät tarjolla olevia pilvipalveluita (Azure, AWS, GCP).

Description:
We are looking for an engineer with outstanding technical skills and experience in quality related topics in industry to join our global technical organization and take over ownership of field quality during both the design-in and post-sales phases of the customers and distributors.

This is an exciting new opportunity to make an immediate impact in delivering our world-class products and solutions. You are guiding customers through our field failure analysis process and ensure that we are fully utilizing the performance capabilities of u-blox GNSS, Short Range ,Cellular modem products and Services with respected areas. With responsibility and ownership of regional quality related topics in EMEA and AMER regions, this position has the potential to expand through global organization in the future with interesting career development.

Working with cutting edge technology, you should have outstanding communication skills to help customer and partners fully utilize the best practice and u-blox quality awareness of u-blox products. At the forefront of technology, you will be supporting the sales process and collaborating closely with our global quality, field application engineers and sales teams by advising customers from early evaluation phase until end-of-life of our products. You will assist field team throughout the design-in process and application development. You will provide support to all quality related topics with customers including coordination of failure analysis of customer applications. You will interact with other FAE’s throughout EMEA and AMER as well as with the Quality teams, organize technical training and audits, provide detailed technical and market feedback in related area. There will be an opportunity for European and American travels.




We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief.

Description:
Job title: Structural Analyst Engineer (FEA)
Location: Espoo, Finland OR Spain
Hiring Model: Hybrid
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
To support the company’s growth, we continue to scale our Structural Analysis/Mechanical team and looking for a Structural Analyst (FEA) Engineer to join our global Spacecraft Engineering Team.
About the role?
As a Structural Analyst Engineer, you will analyze the structure for strength and resiliency on the whole spacecraft, how it behaves as an entire unit, but also on smaller components of the satellite - verify and analyze the mechanical structures produced by the Mechanical Team to ensure it will survive launch and the environment.

Description:
We are looking for a Frontend Developer to join the Compensate product team.
Compensate is revolutionizing the way people and companies take responsibility for the climate, and as our Frontend Developer, you’ll play an integral role in our mission. We aim to offer everyone easy access to high-integrity carbon capture solutions, and we believe that well-designed web applications are crucial to achieving this.
You would work closely with our product team of two Developers, a UX Engineer, and a Product Manager to help build bold web applications that have a planetary impact. We’re a small, tight-knit team which allows us to work together closely and support each other to solve complex problems. Your opinions will be valued, and we hope that you’ll bring curiosity and inquisitiveness to help us strive towards always building better solutions. You’ll collaborate closely with our UX Engineer, who is responsible for our frontend solutions. We utilize the Jamstack to build fast websites at scale while considering the developer experience.

Description:
Company Description

About Bosch Sensortec
Bosch Sensortec is the technology leader in sensing solutions based on microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and dedicated to the consumer electronics world. for smartphone applications, tablets, video game consoles, wearables, and the Internet of Things. The sensors enable devices to recognize their surroundings and to transmit the data collected. MEMS are therefore part of the foundation for a networked world. Description:
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.


In this role, you would be developing the backend and customer facing API of our Satellite Order Management system, a user interface where our products and services are made available. This team consists of 10+ engineers working on the backend, frontend, or both. The team is supported by a UX designer, DevOps, and security engineer.
You will be developing new features, as well as new software from scratch, to make modular and extensible systems, highly available and horizontally scalable. You will help design and implement all layers of it, and also provide APIs to both internal and external stakeholders. Our stack is for the most part Go (Golang) microservices running on Kubernetes in AWS. We follow an agile process, build Infrastructure-as-code, aim at best practices, and are always willing to improve.

Description:
What to expect from this role?
We make sense of our customers' RFID data – you ensure our tailor-made RFID systems depict these data meaningfully.
A key element in our track and trace platform is the Turck Vilant Server, which collects and analyses data from a fixed and mobile RFID reader network. In addition, it provides a web-based user interface that, e.g., visualizes the movement of RFID-tagged assets for the user. It will be your task to develop further and design the front end of our Server applications.
You will join our skilled software team in Otaniemi, Espoo. The team works in a hybrid mode, partly from their home offices and partly from the office, so it will be up to you to choose where and how you would like to work, bearing in mind that we would like to see you at the office at a minimum once per week.

Job_title: Control Platform New Product Introduction (NPI) Engineer - Electronics
Description:
Job Description Summary
Grid Solutions delivers ‘Green Transition’ high power (>100MVAr) Flexible AC Transmission Systems (FACTS) as Static Synchronous Compensators (STATCOM) and Static Var Compensators (SVC) to support Renewable Energy systems. These are used to control power system voltage and reactive power flow as well as to improve the power system stability and transmission system efficiency. FACTS devices are also typically used to improve the integration of renewables to the power system making the future power system more sustainable.

The Center of Excellence of power electronics-based products STATCOM and SVC is in Tampere, Finland.

In this position, you will performing research and development around SVC and STATCOM solutions and you will be reporting to global FACTS NPI Manager.

The position will be based in Tampere, Finland.

Description:
Position: Machine Learning Engineer
Location: Luxembourg, Finland
Hiring Model: Hybrid/ On-site
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help explore novel deep learning capabilities that can be applied to remote sensing imagery. You will report to the Machine Learning Team Lead in the Analytics Department. We are looking for candidates in Finland or those who want to relocate to Finland.



:


Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE
We are making the impossible possible together.
Contact
Olha Pryshlyak
Recruiting@iceye.fi

Job_title: FAST Rotation Program-Field Applications Engineer Track - FInland
Description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
This 11-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams.
Rotation 1 (6 month), Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.

Description:
We are looking for an engineer with outstanding technical skills and experience in quality related topics in industry to join our global technical organization and take over ownership of field quality during both the design-in and post-sales phases of the customers and distributors.

This is an exciting new opportunity to make an immediate impact in delivering our world-class products and solutions. You are guiding customers through our field failure analysis process and ensure that we are fully utilizing the performance capabilities of u-blox GNSS, Short Range ,Cellular modem products and Services with respected areas. With responsibility and ownership of regional quality related topics in EMEA and AMER regions, this position has the potential to expand through global organization in the future with interesting career development.

Working with cutting edge technology, you should have outstanding communication skills to help customer and partners fully utilize the best practice and u-blox quality awareness of u-blox products. At the forefront of technology, you will be supporting the sales process and collaborating closely with our global quality, field application engineers and sales teams by advising customers from early evaluation phase until end-of-life of our products. You will assist field team throughout the design-in process and application development. You will provide support to all quality related topics with customers including coordination of failure analysis of customer applications. You will interact with other FAE’s throughout EMEA and AMER as well as with the Quality teams, organize technical training and audits, provide detailed technical and market feedback in related area. There will be an opportunity for European and American travels.




We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief.
