Description:
Would you like to contribute to the success of a company whose product is a crucial element of modern societies, with the highest recycled content and the lowest carbon footprint in its industry?
Then Outokumpu is a perfect place for you!
We are now looking for a Mine Planning Technician to join our Geology & Mine Planning team.

We are offering highly interesting mine surrounding in the largest underground mining operation in Finland. Our annual ore production is approx. 2.4 million tons with exceptional long life of mine. We are currently working with DeepMine -project, goal is to excavate & construct new main level, primary crusher and shaft at 1000 meters depth till beginning of 2023. Kemi Mine produces chromium concentrates to feed Outokumpu’s own smelter in Tornio. Oxidic Chromium ore does not contain any sulfide minerals and our concentration process is based on gravimetry therefore our operational impact towards nature is minor.

You will be part of very experienced team in which we work seamlessly together, sharing knowledge and open-minded ideas. You will be based in Kemi and report to the Production Planning Engineer.

Description:
Company Description

About Bosch Sensortec
Bosch Sensortec is the technology leader in sensing solutions based on microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) and dedicated to the consumer electronics world. for smartphone applications, tablets, video game consoles, wearables, and the Internet of Things. The sensors enable devices to recognize their surroundings and to transmit the data collected. MEMS are therefore part of the foundation for a networked world. Our success in MEMS sensors and solutions is built on a remarkable team driven by passion, innovation and flexibility.
Here at Bosch, we are creating the future by inventing technologies and services of high quality that can enrich peoples' lives. Our promise to our employees is solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join us and feel the difference!

Description:
Position: Lead Quality Software Engineer
Location: Espoo, Finland
Hiring Model: Hybrid

Who are we:
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!

What do we do:
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.


To support the company's growth, we are now looking for an experienced Lead Quality Engineer to join our Flight Software team. The position location is in our headquarters in Espoo, Finland.


ICEYE is committed to delivering high-quality data on time to its customers. You will help to ensure it will keep happening working in the Flight Software team.
Our team is responsible for the software that runs in the embedded systems of ICEYE’s spacecraft. This software manages onboard activities, data processing, power management, communication with the ground, propulsion system, and spacecraft health and safety. You will work with technologies such as Embedded Linux, ARM-based microcontrollers, SoCs, and RTOS.
The Flight Software team is a critical group in the company, continuously implementing new features and developing new subsystems for the new satellites and the ones in our fleet. You will build and lead the process and strategy for a good quality approach. We would appreciate it if you could help us with the full view of the test pyramid.






Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are making the impossible possible together.

Contact

Riya Vidhani (Talent Acquisition Partner)

Description:
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
To support the company’s growth, we continue to scale our Communications Network team and are looking for an Antenna Network Engineer to join us in the Helsinki area, Finland. ICEYE Communications Network is responsible for creating high reliability and high throughput communication between the ground systems and the satellites in ICEYE fleet globally. Various teams are working on contact planning and configuration, TT&C chain, payload downlinking and infrastructure around it.
About the role?

As a Senior Networking Engineer, you will work for the Antenna Network & Infrastructure team. Your task is to develop, maintain and improve our infrastructure especially on cloud premises - but also on-premises - which enable us to communicate to the external antennas from ICEYE systems. Together, these will combine the world’s largest SAR satellite network and ground station infrastructure. This includes, but is not limited to, defining infrastructure manifests, maintaining VPN tunnels for command and control with antenna providers, ground station data forwarders and receivers, collaboration of gateway development and configuration, packet forwarding, data stream optimization and spacecraft connection health monitoring and reporting. The team works on both cloud and on-premise environments by supporting the rest of the engineers and other software teams, especially DevOps and IT with specialized antenna-specific configurations.





Diversity & inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are looking forward to receiving your application in English as soon as possible.
We are making the impossible possible together.

Job_title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Go & React/ Typescript)
Description:
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
To support the company's growth, we are looking for a Full Stack Engineer, Satellite Order Management based in our office in Espoo, Finland.


In this role, you would develop a web application's backend and front-end, a user interface where our products and services are available. The team's main objective is to enable our customers to task our satellites, follow their orders, and deliver the data. This team comprises 10+ engineers working on the backend, front end, or both. A UX designer, DevOps, and security engineer support the team. You will develop new features and software from scratch to make modular and extensible systems highly available and horizontally scalable. You will help design and implement all layers and provide internal and external stakeholders APIs. Our stack is mostly Go (Golang) microservices running on Kubernetes in AWS, while the front-end is React and Typescript. We follow an agile process, build Infrastructure-as-code, aim at best practices, and are always willing to improve.





Could this be the role for you? You can just apply now to start your journey with ICEYE.
We are making the impossible possible together.

Description:
At the moment we are looking for experienced Embedded Linux Software Engineer to strengthen our Tampere team. You would start your journey in one of our most interesting and challenging projects.
As a software engineer you will be responsible for SW integration and configuration for the new hardware system in close collaboration with your colleague engineers. You will participate from higher level SW stack components integration down to lower layer SW components. You will also get in touch with the new RISC-V system-on-chip (SoC) SW as provided by SoC vendor. New customer requests may offer an opportunity to design and implement new software. This gives the chance to drive your SW pull request through the open sourcing process.
Your future colleagues are waiting for you to join our international team. We are working in a modern office, almost in the city center of Tampere. Working with us is uncomplicated, there’s a good team spirit, low-hierarchy and nonexistent bureaucracy. Our way of working is flexible too, many of our team work remotely from home with visits to our office from time to time when needed. This role is equally challenging, and as such we offer a very good compensation. We would hope that you are able to start as soon as possible but we are of course ready to be flexible also

Description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Job_title: FAST Rotation Program-Field Applications Engineer Track - FInland
Description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
This 11-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams.
Rotation 1 (6 month), Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.

Description:
Position: Machine Learning Engineer, Senior
Location: Finland
Hiring Model: WAH/ Hybrid/ On-site
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to help explore novel deep learning capabilities that can be applied to remote sensing imagery. You will report to the Machine Learning Team Lead in the Analytics team.



:


Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE.
We are making the impossible possible together.

Olha Pryshlyak
Recruiting@iceye.fi

Description:
We are looking for an engineer with outstanding technical skills and experience in quality related topics in industry to join our global technical organization and take over ownership of field quality during both the design-in and post-sales phases of the customers and distributors.

This is an exciting new opportunity to make an immediate impact in delivering our world-class products and solutions. You are guiding customers through our field failure analysis process and ensure that we are fully utilizing the performance capabilities of u-blox GNSS, Short Range ,Cellular modem products and Services with respected areas. With responsibility and ownership of regional quality related topics in EMEA and AMER regions, this position has the potential to expand through global organization in the future with interesting career development.

Working with cutting edge technology, you should have outstanding communication skills to help customer and partners fully utilize the best practice and u-blox quality awareness of u-blox products. At the forefront of technology, you will be supporting the sales process and collaborating closely with our global quality, field application engineers and sales teams by advising customers from early evaluation phase until end-of-life of our products. You will assist field team throughout the design-in process and application development. You will provide support to all quality related topics with customers including coordination of failure analysis of customer applications. You will interact with other FAE’s throughout EMEA and AMER as well as with the Quality teams, organize technical training and audits, provide detailed technical and market feedback in related area. There will be an opportunity for European and American travels.




We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief.

Description:
Position: Lead Quality Software Engineer
Location: Espoo, Finland
Hiring Model: Hybrid

Who are we:
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!

What do we do:
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.


To support the company's growth, we are now looking for an experienced Lead Quality Engineer to join our Flight Software team. The position location is in our headquarters in Espoo, Finland.


ICEYE is committed to delivering high-quality data on time to its customers. You will help to ensure it will keep happening working in the Flight Software team.
Our team is responsible for the software that runs in the embedded systems of ICEYE’s spacecraft. This software manages onboard activities, data processing, power management, communication with the ground, propulsion system, and spacecraft health and safety. You will work with technologies such as Embedded Linux, ARM-based microcontrollers, SoCs, and RTOS.
The Flight Software team is a critical group in the company, continuously implementing new features and developing new subsystems for the new satellites and the ones in our fleet. You will build and lead the process and strategy for a good quality approach. We would appreciate it if you could help us with the full view of the test pyramid.






Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are making the impossible possible together.

Contact

Riya Vidhani (Talent Acquisition Partner)

riya.vidhani@iceye.fi

The Company
Our client is one of the fastest growing Software companies that own the number one operating system in the cloud sold across the globe as one of the most popular development platforms. Our client`s renown Product is the fastest growing enterprise platform, the leading platform for public cloud compute, and the engineer's favorite path to dive into the future. Description:
At the moment we are looking for experienced Embedded Linux Software Engineer to strengthen our Tampere team. You would start your journey in one of our most interesting and challenging projects.
As a software engineer you will be responsible for SW integration and configuration for the new hardware system in close collaboration with your colleague engineers. You will participate from higher level SW stack components integration down to lower layer SW components. You will also get in touch with the new RISC-V system-on-chip (SoC) SW as provided by SoC vendor. New customer requests may offer an opportunity to design and implement new software. This gives the chance to drive your SW pull request through the open sourcing process.
Your future colleagues are waiting for you to join our international team. We are working in a modern office, almost in the city center of Tampere. Working with us is uncomplicated, there’s a good team spirit, low-hierarchy and nonexistent bureaucracy. Our way of working is flexible too, many of our team work remotely from home with visits to our office from time to time when needed. This role is equally challenging, and as such we offer a very good compensation. We would hope that you are able to start as soon as possible but we are of course ready to be flexible also

Description:
Help us shape the future of open source IT, devops, and IS, from bare metal to containers. Our goal is to revolutionise open source application and infrastructure operations.
We are on a mission to reshape the world of software operations, using Python for next-generation infrastructure-as-code and blazing a trail to model-driven operations. We want to enable companies to run very efficient bare metal operations for high performance computing, private cloud, data lakes and analytics. To achieve this we need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products. In support of that goal we hire software engineers who are passionate about quality, reliability and devops, to join our regional devops teams.
This team is part of our fully managed infrastructure operations organisation. We run many private clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world, which enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python, creating open source operations capabilities that simplify these operations for anybody, worldwide, who is building on Ubuntu.

Description:
Nipromec Oy Ltd is an international consulting and engineering company founded in 2003. We offer design and consulting services for multiple industries with emphasis on energy and construction. Nipromec offices in Finland are located in Rauma, Turku, Tampere and Helsinki. Group has offices also in Erlangen, Germany, Bristol and London in United Kingdom.
We are now looking for a LEAD PIPING ENGINEER to work for customer projects in Tampere region for permanent employment.
You will work as a main designer in versatile Finnish and international industry projects and you will be in charge of a designing group.
As Lead Piping Engineer, you are responsible for coordinating the projects piping engineering discipline, leading core & subcontracted engineering, and working closely with the procurement and other various project functions. Your typical day includes follow-up with team members and progress reporting. You will be a key participant in customer meetings and driving best-in-class customer solutions from the sales phase, continuing through start-up & as built documentation.

Position: Staff Geospatial Software Engineer
Location: Espoo, Finland, remote
Hiring Model: Hybrid
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 nationalities. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
To support the growth of the company, we are looking for a Staff Geospatial Software Engineer to support our ICEYE Analytics in the Helsinki area, Finland. ICEYE Analytics is responsible for building solutions that enable near-real-time assessment of the impact of global natural catastrophes and geophysical change using remote sensing technology. These solutions empower end users to quantitatively make timely actions for event characterization, assessment, and response during stressful and uncertain times.
About the role?
As a Staff Geospatial Software Engineer, you will take a technical leadership of services providing external geospatial data used in ICEYE Solutions Products. You will help to architect and deploy fast, efficient, and scalable geospatial data services and pipelines. You will report to the Director of the Applications Engine in the Analytics team.
Responsibilities


Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE.
We are making the impossible possible together.
Contact
Paul du Plessis
recruiting@iceye.fi

Description:
Would you like to contribute to the success of a company whose product is a crucial element of modern societies, with the highest recycled content and the lowest carbon footprint in its industry?
Then Outokumpu is a perfect place for you!
We are now looking for a Mine Planning Technician to join our Geology & Mine Planning team.
We are offering highly interesting mine surrounding in the largest underground mining operation in Finland. Our annual ore production is approx. 2.4 million tons with exceptional long life of mine. We are currently working with DeepMine -project, goal is to excavate & construct new main level, primary crusher and shaft at 1000 meters depth till beginning of 2023. Kemi Mine produces chromium concentrates to feed Outokumpu's own smelter in Tornio. Oxidic Chromium ore does not contain any sulfide minerals and our concentration process is based on gravimetry therefore our operational impact towards nature is minor.

Help the growing engineering team at Canonical bring the cutting edge of open-source software into the telecommunications sector. As an engineer on the team, you'll bring significant software development experience, public cloud and Kubernetes experience and a keen eye for software design and architecture.
You will be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

Job_title: Senior Antenna Network Engineer (Satellite Communications Network)
Description:
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We’re innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?

ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time – even when it’s cloudy or dark – providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?

To support the company’s growth, we continue to scale our Communications Network team and are looking for a Senior Antenna Network Engineer to join us in the Helsinki area, Finland. ICEYE Communications Network is responsible for creating high reliability and high throughput communication between the ground systems and the satellites in ICEYE fleet globally. Various teams are working on contact planning and configuration, TT&C chain, payload downlinking and infrastructure around it.
About the role?

As a Senior Networking Engineer, you will work for the Antenna Network & Infrastructure. Your task is to develop, maintain and improve our infrastructure especially on cloud premises - but also on-premises - which enable us to communicate to the external antennas from ICEYE systems. Together, these will combine the world’s largest SAR satellite network and ground station infrastructure. This includes, but is not limited to, defining infrastructure manifests, maintaining VPN tunnels for command and control with antenna providers, ground station data forwarders and receivers, collaboration of gateway development and configuration, packet forwarding, data stream optimization and spacecraft connection health monitoring and reporting.
Team works on both cloud and on-premise environments by supporting the rest of the engineers and other software teams, especially DevOps and IT with specialized antenna-specific configurations.






Diversity & inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are looking forward to receiving your application in English as soon as possible.
We are making the impossible possible together.


Anna Cseke (Talent Acquisition Specialist)
anna.cseke@iceye.fi

Description:
This role is an opportunity for a senior software architect to build a career with Canonical and drive the architecture of internally developed and deployed software solutions.
The Commercial Systems team closely collaborates with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems team are used by millions of machines all over the world. Designing and developing these systems requires a high degree of understanding of distributed systems and appreciation for business critical systems and the value of data flowing between the systems. It is crucial for services developed by the Commercial Systems team to flawlessly and securely operate 24/7 and to allow for seamless integration with solutions developed and used by other teams at Canonical, while keeping security at the forefront. Apply here if you would like to be at the center of connecting all the dots and drive the architecture of such software solutions.

Description:
Gofore on digitaalisen muutoksen asiantuntija. Meitä on Suomessa, Saksassa, Itävallassa, Espanjassa, Virossa ja Italiassa noin 1300 alan johtavaa asiantuntijaa. Hyvinvoivat työntekijät ja menestyvät asiakkaat ovat yrityksemme ydin. Monimuotoista osaajajoukkoamme yhdistää pioneerihenkisyys sekä halu työskennellä yrityksessä, jossa luodaan inhimillisempää, kestävämpää ja eettisempää digimaailmaa. Haluamme tarjota parhaat mahdollisuudet työntekijöillemme kehittyä ja kukoistaa – sekä työssä että sen ulkopuolella. Liikevaihtomme vuonna 2022 oli 149,9 miljoonaa euroa. Gofore Oyj:n osake on listattu Nasdaq Helsinki Oy:ssä.
Lisätietoja Goforesta työnantajana löydät halutessasi liity joukkoon- ja kulttuurisivuiltamme.
Goforen matka tulevaisuuden datataloksi on alkanut! Meitä kiinnostaa ympäröivä maailma ja siksipä toimimmekin laaja-alaisesti niin julkisella kuin yksityisellä sektorilla. Monipuolisissa projekteissa teemme läheistä yhteistyötä erityisesti datatieteilijöiden kanssa – tiimissämme pääsee altistumaan data-aiheiden lisäksi mm. tekoälyyn ja koneoppimiseen liittyviin projekteihin.

Description:
Etsimme joukkoomme Data Engineeria mielenkiintoisten asiakashankkeiden pariin. Asiantuntijuus, tiimihenki ja ystävällisyys kuvastavat meitä hiqlaisia, samaa odotamme myös uudelta tiimiläiseltämme.
Data Engineerina työskentelet osana asiakastoimituksiamme. Laajasta asiakasverkostostamme löytyy keskisuuria ja suuria suomalaisia yrityksiä monilta eri toimialoilta.
Olemme erikoistuneet korkealaatuisiin digitaalisiin palveluihin, konsultointiin ja projektitoimituksiin. Ohjelmistokehitys, design, automaatio, dataosaaminen, pilvipalvelut, laadunvarmistus ja jatkuvat palvelut kuuluvat kaikki erityisosaamiseemme.
Kehittäjiltämme odotamme asiantuntemusta ja aitoa intoa teknologiaa kohtaan. Asiakaslähtöisyys ja tiimityöskentelytaidot ovat meidän asiakkuuksissamme avainasemassa. Innostava työyhteisö ja asiantunteva tiimi sekä aktiivinen kompetenssinkehitys ja tiedonjako tukevat onnistumista.

Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team in Helsinki. You will be in charge of creating and managing technological infrastructure of data platforms, including data pipelines, data storage and BI interfaces for querying, modeling and reporting the data. You will work closely with our customers, helping them to make most of their data and to succeed in a data-driven cultural shift.
We expect you to have experience in:
Data analysis and data analysis platforms (preferably with AWS)
Data pipeline design and implementation
Data lake design and implementation
Data quality assurance and verification

Description:
At the moment we are looking for Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Helsinki to work on developing next-generation computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) technologies. The responsibility involves working with various problems related to CV and NLP but is not limited to object recognition, video understanding, OCR, natural language analysis, and visual-language multimodal. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users.
As a member of this team, you will use your deep understanding of your engineering skills to tackle meaningful technical problems and collaborate with the world’s most innovative product development teams. Together with other researchers, you will perform designing, implementing, and optimizing CV/NLP/ML algorithms to tackle new challenges and hardware capabilities in large model training. You will have the opportunity to transfer your knowledge into solutions for some of the most challenging technical problems in the next generation products.

MACHINE LEARNING LOVER
Would you like to be a part of Recordly's story? Now is your chance! We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer eager to help businesses capitalize on the opportunities data and machine learning offer. Working at Recordly means you get to work with customers that truly want to make data and ML/AI their competitive edge.

“WHO/WHAT IS RECORDLY?” YOU MIGHT ASK
Recordly is an independent company part of the Futurice family that specializes in business data management. In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data.

Description:
Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.
About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.

JOIN YOUSICIAN
Yousician impacts and enriches the lives of millions of people by empowering them to play music they love, learn something new, and feel good in the everyday. We merge music and tech to amplify life. We reimagine the way people learn to play, so that everyone can play.

We've built an amazing team of creative, passionate, and independent people, all working together to help millions of people learn, play, and have fun. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a growing and changing scale up business, you're in the right place!

Description:
Our team is comprised of four professionals. Each member has own specialized area, but we collaborate and support each other in technical challenges and in the development of best practices. We work in a hybrid model with broad remote work possibilities, but on-site meetings are required about twice per month. This is a permanent position. Start date is negotiable, but preferably in May 2023.
Working in the Data Integration Team, activities may include:
Expanding our standard data offering to the organization
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data provided to our users

Description:
We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist/Engineer to join our team of +35 people. You'll be involved in turning data from thousands of users into insights integrated with the product.

Data and the interpretation of it is a lifeline, the red thread, for all the things we do at Veri. You can expect to be working closely with most of the areas in the company. Some of the responsibilities you will be sharing with other members of our product teams:
Taking ownership of data-driven feature exploration, experimentation, and implementation
Working closely with our product teams and health advisors to convert business goals into data-driven products and features







(30 minutes)

Description:
Data Engineer
Tehtävässä olet osana tiivistä kehitys- ja ylläpitotiimiä, jonka työnä on rakentaa ja ylläpitää dataputkia sekä kehittää tietovarastointia pankkien viranomaisraportointiin. Menestymisen kannalta olennaisia ominaisuuksia ovat SQL-osaaminen, kiinnostus laajojen kokonaisuuksien hallintaan ja ongelmanratkaisuun sekä sitoutuminen jatkuvaan prosessiin, jossa dataputkia kehitetään ja automatisoidaan. Myös Azure-pilviympäristön tunteminen asettaa sinut etulyöntiasemaan.
Työn ytimen muodostavat datavirran end-to-end hallinnointi lähdejärjestelmistä raportointiin sekä datan jalostaminen käyttökelpoiseen muotoon. Käsiteltävä data liittyy mm. pankkien rahoitusinstrumentteihin ja datan käyttökohteet liittyvät pääosin pankkien riskienhallintaan ja viranomaisraportointiin, joten kiinnostus finanssialaa kohtaan ja ymmärrys pankkiliiketoiminnasta katsotaan eduksi. Tarkka tehtäväsi muotoutuu oman osaamisesi perusteella - tietovarastoinnin syväosaajana pääset aiheen vaikeiden kehitystehtävien pariin ja Azure-osaajana pääset toteuttamaan tietovarastointia myös pilvessä.

Description:
Työpaikan kuvaus
Haluaisitko rakentaa aikaa kestäviä dataratkaisuja ja kehittää pilvipohjaisia palveluja yhdessä muiden huippuasiantuntijoidemme kanssa? Olisimmeko me match made in data cloud? Jos sinulla on pää pilvissä mutta jalat maassa, saatat olla datatekemisemme hopeareunus.
Rekrytoimme aina sopivien dataosaajien osuessa kohdalle ja keskustelemme mielellämme kanssasi siitä, olisitko juuri sinä sopiva lisä tiimiimme. Data Engineerinä osallistut pilvipohjaisten tietoalustojen, dataputkien ja rajapintapalveluiden suunnitteluun, kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon. Asiakasprojekteissamme teemme dataratkaisuja Snowflakeen, AWS:ään ja Azureen ja hyödynnämme lisäksi mm. GCP:tä ja SQL:ää. Asiakasprojektimme ovat monipuolisia, ja asiakastiimeissämme on asiakkuuden tai projektin koosta riippuen usein myös analytiikkakonsultteja, jotka visualisoivat dataa loppukäyttäjille, sekä web-kehittäjiä.

FINLAND
DATA

Description:
At Solita Data Science & Analytics community, we support our clients during their whole AI & Analytics journey – from the very beginning of ideation all the way to scaling the utilization of AI & Analytics across the organisation. We also take a holistic view to business problems, and see that in addition to technical skills, for instance consulting skills and design thinking methods are crucial to identify the problems worth solving – and how best to solve them. In cross-functional teams we develop solutions that harness the potential of AI & analytics technologies, generate value for the end users, and deliver sustainable business impact for the clients.
What does a Machine Learning Architect do?
As a Machine Learning (ML) Architect you will map the current state of AI solutions and related data & analytics capabilities of our customers. You will help them to outline future goals, to identify opportunities ahead, and to create a concrete roadmap to achieve them. Most importantly, you design and build production-grade AI solutions and platforms, where machine learning models are run, e.g. utilizing the capacity and services offered by cloud vendors, and create the best possible conditions for utilizing machine learning models and algorithms in the daily lives of our customers. In projects, you are one of the leading experts and your closest colleagues include Data Scientists, ML Engineers, and AI Service Designers or Strategists. As a senior expert, you also participate in the asset, ways of working, and offering development of Solita.

Who we are
We’re Happeo — a team of passionate problem-solvers, working hard to build the best next-gen intranet out there. Spread across (home) offices, generations, and time zones, we’re on a mission to help organizations grow in extraordinary ways.

You will be our first data engineering hire, and a member of our Platform team.

Description:
Are you a skilled Data Engineer up for owning the data pipeline of an upcoming game, in line to be our second hit? Ready to join one of Europe's fastest growing game companies?

If yes, Metacore could be the right place for you
We are a Helsinki-based game company best known for our hit game Merge Mansion and our people-first company culture. Built on trust, our culture allows us to work autonomously, efficiently, and ambitiously. We have mutually agreed on five cultural norms to describe how we build trust and work as Metacore – you can find them here.

Our company’s mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades. Although we already entertain 40,000,000+ players worldwide and have grown into a team of 120+ game industry professionals in less than two years, we’re only getting started. That’s where we hope you come in: to take ownership of the data pipeline of one of our upcoming games, and ensure its reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your expertise in data engineering, combined with your enthusiasm for data analysis, will enable you to generate informative visualizations and pursue engaging data science initiatives that enhance the team's performance.
Pros: ['"Fostering a company culture in a way that has been well thought out from the outset, revisited regularly and is exemplified by the founders A clear commitment to everybody’s wellbeing You\'re given true trust, where decisions are made by those who know best Every effort is made to promote togetherness as we grow Transparency as to where the company is going Fantastic colleagues that are all pushing in the same directionSo yeah, I’m a fan of this company and I could really recommend it to anyone looking for an interesting game career opportunity in Helsinki." Description:
We are now looking for a Data & Cloud Engineer to join the concrete pioneers at Betolar!
Do you strive for elegant and technically sound implementations? You have a wide profile with an emphasis on Data and Cloud engineering. Security is not just an afterthought for you. We are looking for a senior hands-on person with a sense of ownership and a self-starter mindset.
The actual work spans from standardizing data, to building out data pipelines, and cloud infrastructure. The role is part of our Data team and collaborating closely with our CloudOps function and product teams.
In terms of data volume, we are not among the big players, nor do we have tight latency requirements yet. However, the data is rich, and the problems are massively convoluted and non-trivial. And do check out our website, we strive for real impact fast!

The Packaging Solutions division develops and sells premium fiber-based packaging products and services. Our high-end eco-friendly packaging products are used by leading brands across multiple market sectors, including store retail, e-commerce and industrials. The portfolio includes corrugated and other converting, design services, automation solutions, and scalable innovations such as formed fiber and biocomposites.

We are looking for a Data and Analytics Developer to join us in creating solutions which enable business using facts to follow up the business performance and predict future business conditions with the help of data. You will work in Packaging Solutions Data Services team and report to its Team Lead. Your location could be at any of Stora Enso´s sites in Finland, Sweden or Czech Republic.

Career for a better climate. Every day.

As a Data and Analytics Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining analytics and reporting solutions. Tasks can vary from simple Excel to PowerBI solutions to data engineering on our Data Cloud. You will work as a part of Data Services team where we deliver value to our business by utilizing Agile methods and tools.

Description:
HypeHype Inc. (previously Frogmind) is an award-winning independent mobile games studio from Helsinki founded in 2012. We are best known for our games BADLAND series, Badland Brawl and Rumble Stars series which have garnered over 180 million players and won multiple industry awards.
Our ambitious new goal is to enable anyone to become a game maker in the same way YouTube & Tiktok did with video creators. We are building a new social user-generated content platform for creating, remixing and playing online games with a mobile phone, tablet or desktop. HypeHype, currently in early access, offers all the tools for making modern games and takes game creation from months of complex PC development to just hours of visual editing on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer.

Etsimme kokeneita Data Engineeraja työskentelemään sekä pohjoismaissa että kansainvälisesti vaikuttavissa asiakasprojekteissa. Meillä pääset suunnittelemaan ja toteuttamaan moderneja data-ratkaisuja pilvipalveluiden päälle. Suomessa tukenasi on 50 hengen data- , ohjelmistokehitys-, design- sekä strategiatyön osaajien työyhteisö.
Arki Data Engineerinä
Meillä työskentelet yhdessä Thoughtworksin tiimin kanssa asiakasprojekteissa. Pääset työskentelemään Thougthworksiläisten kanssa vaihtelevissa projekteissa, jotka kestävät pääasiassa muutamasta kuukaudesta puoleen vuoteen, mutta löytyy meiltä pidempiäkin projekteja. Asiakasprojekteissamme rakennetaan muun muassa tietovarastoja, kerätään datoja asiakkaan järjestelmistä ja jalostetaan niistä asiakkaan datastrategiaa palvelevia datatuotteita. Työskentelet yhdessä Data Scientistien kanssa ja pääset rakentamaan dataputkia osana koneoppimisen ja tekoäly-projektien toteuttamista (käsittää esimerkiksi koneoppimista, lineaarista ohjelmointia, generatiivista mallinnusta, syy-seurauspäättelyä/kausaalipäättelyä).

Description:
The ideal candidate for this opening is someone who is willing to work crossfunctionally on both data science features and data processing at an ambitious startup.

Personally, you are:
Self-motivated
Honest and passionate
Learn quickly and continously
Meeshkan employees are those who:
Communicate effectively with clients and teammates
Curious about technology and the impact it can make on the world
Tasks

Requirements

Benefits

This role works closely with Mike Meeshkan’s CEO, and with the engineering team.


1. 30 minute video call with our COO, Makenna
2. Take home exercise, if applicable
3. Video call with Mike, CEO of Meeshkan
4. Offer & "What will make you most successful in this position?"

On average the whole process takes 2-3 weeks end to end, but we're pretty flexible!

We understand the combination of backend and data science chops, is a hard one to find. Our preference is on candidates with strong backend experience, we have an incredible team of data science engineers that you can collaborate with and learn from!

Even if you don't believe you fit all of the requirements but you're interested in the product / position — please apply! We're looking forward to hearing from you.

Gofore on digitaalisen muutoksen asiantuntija. Meitä on Suomessa, Saksassa, Itävallassa, Espanjassa, Virossa ja Italiassa noin 1300 alan johtavaa asiantuntijaa. Hyvinvoivat työntekijät ja menestyvät asiakkaat ovat yrityksemme ydin. Monimuotoista osaajajoukkoamme yhdistää pioneerihenkisyys sekä halu työskennellä yrityksessä, jossa luodaan inhimillisempää, kestävämpää ja eettisempää digimaailmaa. Haluamme tarjota parhaat mahdollisuudet työntekijöillemme kehittyä ja kukoistaa – sekä työssä että sen ulkopuolella. Liikevaihtomme vuonna 2022 oli 149,9 miljoonaa euroa. Gofore Oyj:n osake on listattu Nasdaq Helsinki Oy:ssä.
Lisätietoja Goforesta työnantajana löydät halutessasi liity joukkoon- ja kulttuurisivuiltamme.
Goforen matka tulevaisuuden datataloksi on alkanut! Meitä kiinnostaa ympäröivä maailma ja siksipä toimimmekin laaja-alaisesti niin julkisella kuin yksityisellä sektorilla. Monipuolisissa projekteissa teemme läheistä yhteistyötä erityisesti datatieteilijöiden kanssa – tiimissämme pääsee altistumaan data-aiheiden lisäksi mm. tekoälyyn ja koneoppimiseen liittyviin projekteihin.

Description:

Data analysis and data analysis platforms (preferably with AWS)
Data pipeline design and implementation

Data quality assurance and verification

Description:
Elisa Data & Analytics department is responsible for development of large-scale analytics to various Elisa's business needs. We value the data and we are focused on learning how to support our customers better and want to produce experiences in our customers' everyday life.
We're looking for a Data Engineer for the Elisa Data & Analytics team to work together with our skilled Architect, Data Engineers and Scientists.
Your main project would be designing and implementing data integrations between different systems and engineering many kinds of solutions for data handling and machine learning. These complex systems require skills from data integration and solid coding experience.
In this job, you can use your skills in a creative and versatile way right at the heart of our company. You will get a chance to make your own system choices and direct development work in the right direction in line with your own vision.

Description:
We are now looking for a Data & Cloud Engineer to join the concrete pioneers at Betolar!
Do you strive for elegant and technically sound implementations? You have a wide profile with an emphasis on Data and Cloud engineering. Security is not just an afterthought for you. We are looking for a senior hands-on person with a sense of ownership and a self-starter mindset.
The actual work spans from standardizing data, to building out data pipelines, and cloud infrastructure. The role is part of our Data team and collaborating closely with our CloudOps function and product teams.
In terms of data volume, we are not among the big players, nor do we have tight latency requirements yet. However, the data is rich, and the problems are massively convoluted and non-trivial. And do check out our website, we strive for real impact fast!

JOIN YOUSICIAN
Yousician impacts and enriches the lives of millions of people by empowering them to play music they love, learn something new, and feel good in the everyday. We merge music and tech to amplify life. We reimagine the way people learn to play, so that everyone can play.
And, you don't need to be a musician to join Yousician!
We've built an amazing team of creative, passionate, and independent people, all working together to help millions of people learn, play, and have fun. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a growing and changing scale up business, you're in the right place!

Description:
Etsimme joukkoomme Data Engineeria mielenkiintoisten asiakashankkeiden pariin. Asiantuntijuus, tiimihenki ja ystävällisyys kuvastavat meitä hiqlaisia, samaa odotamme myös uudelta tiimiläiseltämme.
Data Engineerina työskentelet osana asiakastoimituksiamme. Laajasta asiakasverkostostamme löytyy keskisuuria ja suuria suomalaisia yrityksiä monilta eri toimialoilta.
Olemme erikoistuneet korkealaatuisiin digitaalisiin palveluihin, konsultointiin ja projektitoimituksiin. Ohjelmistokehitys, design, automaatio, dataosaaminen, pilvipalvelut, laadunvarmistus ja jatkuvat palvelut kuuluvat kaikki erityisosaamiseemme.
Kehittäjiltämme odotamme asiantuntemusta ja aitoa intoa teknologiaa kohtaan. Asiakaslähtöisyys ja tiimityöskentelytaidot ovat meidän asiakkuuksissamme avainasemassa. Innostava työyhteisö ja asiantunteva tiimi sekä aktiivinen kompetenssinkehitys ja tiedonjako tukevat onnistumista.

Description:
Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.
About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.

Description:
The Packaging Solutions division develops and sells premium fiber-based packaging products and services. Our high-end eco-friendly packaging products are used by leading brands across multiple market sectors, including store retail, e-commerce and industrials. The portfolio includes corrugated and other converting, design services, automation solutions, and scalable innovations such as formed fiber and biocomposites.

We are looking for a Data and Analytics Developer to join us in creating solutions which enable business using facts to follow up the business performance and predict future business conditions with the help of data. You will work in Packaging Solutions Data Services team and report to its Team Lead. Your location could be at any of Stora Enso´s sites in Finland, Sweden or Czech Republic.

Career for a better climate. Every day.

As a Data and Analytics Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining analytics and reporting solutions. Tasks can vary from simple Excel to PowerBI solutions to data engineering on our Data Cloud. You will work as a part of Data Services team where we deliver value to our business by utilizing Agile methods and tools.

Description:
Are you a skilled Data Engineer up for owning the data pipeline of an upcoming game, in line to be our second hit? Ready to join one of Europe's fastest growing game companies?

If yes, Metacore could be the right place for you
We are a Helsinki-based game company best known for our hit game Merge Mansion and our people-first company culture. Built on trust, our culture allows us to work autonomously, efficiently, and ambitiously. We have mutually agreed on five cultural norms to describe how we build trust and work as Metacore – you can find them here.

Our company’s mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades. Although we already entertain 40,000,000+ players worldwide and have grown into a team of 120+ game industry professionals in less than two years, we’re only getting started. That’s where we hope you come in: to take ownership of the data pipeline of one of our upcoming games, and ensure its reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your expertise in data engineering, combined with your enthusiasm for data analysis, will enable you to generate informative visualizations and pursue engaging data science initiatives that enhance the team's performance.

Description:
Data Engineer
Tehtävässä olet osana tiivistä kehitys- ja ylläpitotiimiä, jonka työnä on rakentaa ja ylläpitää dataputkia sekä kehittää tietovarastointia pankkien viranomaisraportointiin. Menestymisen kannalta olennaisia ominaisuuksia ovat SQL-osaaminen, kiinnostus laajojen kokonaisuuksien hallintaan ja ongelmanratkaisuun sekä sitoutuminen jatkuvaan prosessiin, jossa dataputkia kehitetään ja automatisoidaan. Myös Azure-pilviympäristön tunteminen asettaa sinut etulyöntiasemaan.
Työn ytimen muodostavat datavirran end-to-end hallinnointi lähdejärjestelmistä raportointiin sekä datan jalostaminen käyttökelpoiseen muotoon. Käsiteltävä data liittyy mm. pankkien rahoitusinstrumentteihin ja datan käyttökohteet liittyvät pääosin pankkien riskienhallintaan ja viranomaisraportointiin, joten kiinnostus finanssialaa kohtaan ja ymmärrys pankkiliiketoiminnasta katsotaan eduksi. Tarkka tehtäväsi muotoutuu oman osaamisesi perusteella - tietovarastoinnin syväosaajana pääset aiheen vaikeiden kehitystehtävien pariin ja Azure-osaajana pääset toteuttamaan tietovarastointia myös pilvessä.

Description:
DATA ENGINEER
Would you like to be a part of Recordly's story? Now is your chance! We’re looking for a Data Engineer who wants to get their hands dirty with different data solutions, platforms, and pipelines. Working at Recordly means you get to work with customers that truly want to make data their competitive edge. You will be at the core of helping businesses capitalize on the opportunities data offers.

“WHO/WHAT IS RECORDLY?” YOU MIGHT ASK
Recordly is an independent company party of the Futurice family specializing in business data management. Our core business focuses on data management, data architectures, and hands-on data engineering that enable exceptional user experiences, efficiency gains, and new business models. In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data.

Description:
At the moment we are looking for Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Helsinki to work on developing next-generation computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) technologies. The responsibility involves working with various problems related to CV and NLP but is not limited to object recognition, video understanding, OCR, natural language analysis, and visual-language multimodal. You will join a close-knit team of highly accomplished researchers and research engineers to deliver cutting-edge technologies that impact millions of users.
As a member of this team, you will use your deep understanding of your engineering skills to tackle meaningful technical problems and collaborate with the world’s most innovative product development teams. Together with other researchers, you will perform designing, implementing, and optimizing CV/NLP/ML algorithms to tackle new challenges and hardware capabilities in large model training. You will have the opportunity to transfer your knowledge into solutions for some of the most challenging technical problems in the next generation products.

Description:
At Solita Data Science & Analytics community, we support our clients during their whole AI & Analytics journey – from the very beginning of ideation all the way to scaling the utilization of AI & Analytics across the organisation. We also take a holistic view to business problems, and see that in addition to technical skills, for instance consulting skills and design thinking methods are crucial to identify the problems worth solving – and how best to solve them. In cross-functional teams we develop solutions that harness the potential of AI & analytics technologies, generate value for the end users, and deliver sustainable business impact for the clients.
What does a Machine Learning Architect do?
As a Machine Learning (ML) Architect you will map the current state of AI solutions and related data & analytics capabilities of our customers. You will help them to outline future goals, to identify opportunities ahead, and to create a concrete roadmap to achieve them. Most importantly, you design and build production-grade AI solutions and platforms, where machine learning models are run, e.g. utilizing the capacity and services offered by cloud vendors, and create the best possible conditions for utilizing machine learning models and algorithms in the daily lives of our customers. In projects, you are one of the leading experts and your closest colleagues include Data Scientists, ML Engineers, and AI Service Designers or Strategists. As a senior expert, you also participate in the asset, ways of working, and offering development of Solita.

Description:
MACHINE LEARNING LOVER
Would you like to be a part of Recordly's story? Now is your chance! We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer eager to help businesses capitalize on the opportunities data and machine learning offer. Working at Recordly means you get to work with customers that truly want to make data and ML/AI their competitive edge.

“WHO/WHAT IS RECORDLY?” YOU MIGHT ASK
Recordly is an independent company part of the Futurice family that specializes in business data management. Our core business focuses on data management, data architectures, and hands-on data engineering that enable exceptional user experiences, efficiency gains, and new business models. In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data.

Cons: ['No Cons have been reported by the Glassdoor community.']

Description:
HypeHype Inc. (previously Frogmind) is an award-winning independent mobile games studio from Helsinki founded in 2012. We are best known for our games BADLAND series, Badland Brawl and Rumble Stars series which have garnered over 180 million players and won multiple industry awards.
Our ambitious new goal is to enable anyone to become a game maker in the same way YouTube & Tiktok did with video creators. We are building a new social user-generated content platform for creating, remixing and playing online games with a mobile phone, tablet or desktop. HypeHype, currently in early access, offers all the tools for making modern games and takes game creation from months of complex PC development to just hours of visual editing on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer.

Työpaikan kuvaus
Haluaisitko rakentaa aikaa kestäviä dataratkaisuja ja kehittää pilvipohjaisia palveluja yhdessä muiden huippuasiantuntijoidemme kanssa? Olisimmeko me match made in data cloud? Jos sinulla on pää pilvissä mutta jalat maassa, saatat olla datatekemisemme hopeareunus.
Rekrytoimme aina sopivien dataosaajien osuessa kohdalle ja keskustelemme mielellämme kanssasi siitä, olisitko juuri sinä sopiva lisä tiimiimme. Data Engineerinä osallistut pilvipohjaisten tietoalustojen, dataputkien ja rajapintapalveluiden suunnitteluun, kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon. Asiakasprojekteissamme teemme dataratkaisuja Snowflakeen, AWS:ään ja Azureen ja hyödynnämme lisäksi mm. GCP:tä ja SQL:ää. Asiakasprojektimme ovat monipuolisia, ja asiakastiimeissämme on asiakkuuden tai projektin koosta riippuen usein myös analytiikkakonsultteja, jotka visualisoivat dataa loppukäyttäjille, sekä web-kehittäjiä.

Job_title: FAST Rotation Program-Field Applications Engineer Track - FInland
Description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it. TI’s FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Rotation Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI’s business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
This 11-month experience aims to establish rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) as technical TI experts with customer engineers and internal teams.
Rotation 1 (6 month), Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI’s revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.

Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
SALES ENGINEER, FINLAND
We are looking for a Sales Engineer who is accustomed to solving customer’s most complex problems and closing large deals. In this role you will work directly with the sales team and channel partners to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate winning sales cycles, provide compelling value-based demonstrations, support enterprise Proof of Concepts, and ultimately close business.
As a Snowflake Sales Engineer you must share our passion about reinventing the Data Warehousing space, thrive in a dynamic environment and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and talking shop with technical audiences.

Description:
Our team is comprised of four professionals. Each member has own specialized area, but we collaborate and support each other in technical challenges and in the development of best practices. We work in a hybrid model with broad remote work possibilities, but on-site meetings are required about twice per month. This is a permanent position. Start date is negotiable, but preferably in May 2023.
Working in the Data Integration Team, activities may include:
Expanding our standard data offering to the organization
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data provided to our users
